definition: to sleep in separate rooms/distribution of social housing

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Easy handle rooming list of group.
sentences.chinese: 輕鬆處理團隊客人分房。

sentences.english: Of course, the biggest change is the abolition of the welfare housing distribution policy.
sentences.chinese: 當然，最大的變化是取消福利分房政策。

sentences.english: In some cases, couples have to sleep in separate bedrooms.
sentences.chinese: 有些情形下夫妻必須分房睡。

sentences.english: Sometimes they sleep in the same bed, sometimes they don't.
sentences.chinese: 他們偶爾同牀睡，有時分房睡。
